pages.text: $(#551012)Cycle 37, Entry 7 $(br2)I came across them again, those twisted beings wandering the depths of the Nether. They were once... something else, something closer to what we were before everything went wrong. Now, they are shadows, grotesque and tormented, lashing out at any who draw near.

$(#551012)They seem to be searching for something with a desperate intensity. There are whispers about an ancient relic, the Dreadstone Tablet... I remember pieces of its purpose. It was meant to hold significant power, but the specifics elude me, lost in the haze of my fragmented memories before the ritual. Could this be what they seek? And why? The familiarity I feel in their despair haunts me.

$(#551012)I picked up a fragment dropped by one of the Dreadswine. It pulses with a strange energy, almost like a heartbeat. There's something both fascinating and unsettling about it. The Dreadswine's obsession with the tablet makes me wonder if it holds more power than I understand. Could it be a key to understanding our curse, or is it just another cruel illusion in this nightmare?

$(#551012)Their quest for the Dreadstone Tablet might be the only thing keeping them from descending further into madness. I must learn more about this relic. It’s strange how some memories remain so vivid, while others fade into obscurity. Perhaps it’s the curse, or perhaps it’s something about me. Each cycle, the fragments I retain feel like pieces of a puzzle I’m desperate to complete.$(br)—Elara
